newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Stockholm joins Euro bourse bounce.
newsitem.headline: Stockholm joins Euro bourse bounce.

text.p: The Stockholm bourse opened more than one percent higher on Wednesday, jumping along with most European exchanges after comments on the U.S. economy by Federal Reserve Chairman Alan Greenspan sent the Dow to a record close.
The bourse's general index had climbed 1.55 percent, or 48.80 points, to 3,188.34 by 0815 GMT after 15 minutes trade.
All main Swedish indices maintained a steady rise and after 30 minutes trading were around two percent higher. The general index was 1.77 percent up and the OMX index was 2.09 percent higher.

Volvo, in favour after solid first half profits reported on Tuesday, jumped seven crowns to 220 crowns, a year high. Mobile phone giant Ericsson, due to post its results on Thursday, rose a more stately 1.5 crowns to 331.5 crowns.
